data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you face backward, you go forward. When you face forward, you go backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps to the starting point and turn around, you could get to the starting point by turning right. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around you take 10 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 1 step after you have taken 7 steps, you complete the sequence of 7 steps, 7 steps and one step. The final answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn around are the same sequence of steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around takes 7 steps in the same direction. The starting point is the same direction as where you left off. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If 8 steps are taken and 9 steps are taken then it is the same as turning right again and back to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning around is a different action than leaving the starting point. If there is a start point, taking 6 steps is the same as leaving the starting point and returning with 8 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward this means you always take 2 steps forward and never retrace your steps. If you always face the same direction this means you always take 4 steps forward. If you always take 6 steps forward then this means you always take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps and return to starting point. Take 9 steps and return to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One way of dealing with this problem is to step forward and take a step backwards. So, the answer is No.

Right: 8 steps. Steps backward: 6 steps. Steps right: 8 steps. Step backward: 1 step. Steps left: 2 steps. So, the answer is No.

The instructions are to always face forward. They don’ t say they do or don’t do anything. They say when doing the instructions, you always have to face forward. They are not to always look at someone. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One can return to the starting point in each direction. So, the answer is yes.

If one is facing forward, you always take first step. If one is facing left, one takes first step and next steps are forward and backward. If one is facing right, one takes first step and next steps are backward. The first step, one takes, is the first step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around you take 4 steps back to your start point. The following sequence is the same on both sides. So, the answer is No.

You can’t turn around while you’re turning around. Turning around and turning right are the same action. So, the answer is no.

This is a progression in the direction of the forward motion. Steps 2 and 5 are backward steps. To come forward again, you will step forward and step back and then step left and right. If you take 5 steps backward, the return is the same as the first step. So, the answer is No.

If someone faces backward, then the image is facing backward. If someone faces forward, then the image is facing forward. Taking one step backward is a step backward. So, the answer is No.

Thus, the answer is No.

The first instruction in the exercise only involves facing forward. After facing forward, everyone turns to facing to the left to avoid taking 4 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

One needs to travel backwards to get back on the track. The starting point is facing forward. One needs the right to do the opposite as 5 + 9 = 15, 18, and 21 respectively. Thus, the answer is No.

In the first picture, you are facing forward. In the 2nd picture, you are facing backward. In the 3rd picture, you are facing forward. In the 6th picture, you are facing forward.
